keyMoments.title: Chicken's Debut
keyMoments.description: Chicken makes a brief appearance in this episode.
keyMoments.significance: Minor character introduction in the Post-War Arc.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Attacks Jinbe
keyMoments.description: Consumed by grief and self-blame, Luffy lashes out at Jinbe in desperation, attempting to punch him and eventually biting him.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the depth of Luffy's emotional trauma following Ace's death and his destructive self-blame.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Realizes What He Still Has
keyMoments.description: After hearing Jinbe's speech, Luffy pictures all of his crew members and realizes he still has his nakama waiting for him.
keyMoments.significance: Luffy's emotional turning point - he begins to heal from Ace's death by remembering his crew.

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Tearful Cry
keyMoments.description: Luffy breaks down and screams his desire to see his crew again, marking his acceptance of Ace's death and renewed determination.
keyMoments.significance: The defining character moment of the episode - Luffy's path to recovery begins.

reveals.information: Luffy reaches his emotional breaking point but finds the strength to move forward by remembering what he still has - his crew

keyMoments.title: Jinbe Defeats Luffy
keyMoments.description: Jinbe physically overpowers and pins down Luffy, setting the stage for his emotional intervention.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's strength and his willingness to be tough on Luffy for his own good.

keyMoments.title: Jinbe's Pivotal Speech
keyMoments.description: Jinbe delivers one of the most powerful speeches in One Piece, asking Luffy to focus on what he still has rather than what he has lost.
keyMoments.significance: This speech is the turning point for Luffy's emotional recovery and cements Jinbe's role as a crucial ally and future crew member.
keyMoments.quote: Do not simply count what you have lost. What's gone is gone! But ask yourself this, What remains?

reveals.information: Jinbe demonstrates the wisdom and emotional intelligence that will make him invaluable to the Straw Hat crew

keyMoments.title: Garp Returns to Foosha Village
keyMoments.description: Garp returns to his hometown after the war to check on the village, sinking pirate ships along the way.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Garp maintaining his duty while dealing with personal grief.

keyMoments.title: Confronted by Dadan
keyMoments.description: Dadan physically attacks Garp, blaming him for not saving Ace, forcing Garp to face the consequences of his choices.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the depth of Garp's guilt and the impossible position he was in between duty and family.

reveals.information: Garp is suffering immensely from Ace's death and the guilt of not being able to save him

keyMoments.title: Dadan Attacks Garp
keyMoments.description: Dadan violently confronts Garp about his failure to save Ace, expressing her deep grief and anger.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Dadan's maternal love for Ace and Luffy, and her willingness to hold even a Marine Vice Admiral accountable.

relationships.description: Dadan blames Garp for Ace's death despite understanding his difficult position

evolutionMoments.description: Dadan physically attacks Garp in grief and anger over Ace's death

reveals.information: Despite her grief over Ace, Dadan declares her full support for Luffy's pirate dreams

keyMoments.title: Makino Defends Garp
keyMoments.description: Makino intervenes to defend Garp, suggesting he is the one suffering most, and tearfully recalls Ace and Luffy's childhood.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Makino's compassion and understanding of the complexity of Garp's situation.

keyMoments.title: Shanks at Ace's Burial
keyMoments.description: Shanks and his crew help the Whitebeard Pirates conduct funeral ceremonies for Ace and Whitebeard in the New World.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Shanks' respect for Whitebeard and Ace, and his continued connection to Luffy's story.

keyMoments.title: Shanks' Silent Message
keyMoments.description: Shanks silently communicates his support for Luffy, giving him permission to grieve while encouraging forward movement.
keyMoments.significance: Maintains Shanks' role as Luffy's spiritual mentor and foreshadows their eventual reunion.

keyMoments.title: Marco Thanks Shanks
keyMoments.description: As the Whitebeard Pirates' acting leader, Marco expresses gratitude to Shanks for helping them hold the funeral for Ace and Whitebeard.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the respect between the Whitebeard and Red Hair Pirates, and Marco's leadership role.
